comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: There are no official 32-bit unix packages.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @ek4 we haven't had any requests for x86 built binaries until now.  Unless there is a number of customers asking for 32-bit support, it's a burden to regularly build and test.  For now, we could update our build script to output 32-bit binaries if the packaging/validation can be owned by the community.

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: Also, AFAICT, .NET Core supports only 64-bit Linux.  The only 32-bit support I see is for ARM.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @rkeithhill excellent point!  Looks like https://github.com/dotnet/coreclr/issues/9265 tracks .NET Core support for x86 Linux.  Until then, nothing we can do.

comments.author: BobVul
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT There is actually one prior request [here](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/4707), plus a [SE question](https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/508581/installing-powershell-on-32-bit-kali-os-fails), so there's at least some interest.
